quick read
- Submissions are open for the 2022 Big Team Science Conference (https://bigteamscienceconference.github.io) , co-hosted by the PSA virtually on October 27-28.

- We are accepting nominations for two Associate Directors and six Assistant Directors.

2022 Big Team Science Conference (https://bigteamscienceconference.github.io/index)

The goal of this two-day virtual conference is to bring together a multidisciplinary group of researchers, funders, and stakeholders to discuss advancements, challenges, and future opportunities related to big team science.

The conference will feature symposia, panel sessions, hackathons, talks, and social hours. We welcome submissions from groups and individuals who are interested in sharing any work related to Big Team Science.

The deadline to complete the Submission Form (https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLScIciauSbdMx7Es0Wnmp9ulOHGZtWlvaXinBm6mkLrd32WZyA/viewform?usp=sf_link)  is July 22.


nominations for leadership positions

We are accepting nominations for two Associate Directors and six Assistant Directors.

Associate Directors serve on the Board of Directors for 4-year terms and will be chosen by a later PSA-wide election. Assistant Directors lead specific committees for 3-year terms and are elected by the Board of Directors.

More information about the roles and how to submit nominations is available here (https://psysciacc.org/news/2022-07-05_nominations-for-psa-leadership-positions.html) .

The Study Selection Committee is seeking new members to aid in selecting projects for the PSA's most recent call for studies. More information is available at this link (https://forms.gle/vJHn9sqgEGPZYGN86) .

COVID Studies (PSA-CR) (https://psysciacc.org/studies/psacr-1-2-3/)

The COVID-19 Message Framing project has been accepted for publication at Affective Science. We are still in the process of updating the pre-print (https://psyarxiv.com/sevkf/) , and hope to receive updated page proofs soon.

A manuscript (https://osf.io/byqha) describing the datasets for the three PSA COVID studies has been submitted to Nature Scientific Data.
